meanings.definition: A person who specializes in phonetics.
meanings.sent1: The phonetists at the university teach students about speech sounds.
meanings.sent2: Many phonetists work in research labs to understand language sounds better.
meanings.sent3: The phonetists had a fun time practicing pronunciation during their study group.
meanings.sent4: The phonetists' ears were like finely tuned instruments, capturing every nuance of speech.
meanings.sent5: The phonetists' passion for phonetics was evident in every conversation they had.

meanings.definition: The phonetists' research focused on speech sounds.
meanings.sent1: The phonetists presented their findings on speech sounds at the conference.
meanings.sent2: The phonetists' lab was filled with equipment to analyze speech sounds.
meanings.sent3: During the experiment, the phonetists accidentally created a new speech sound.
meanings.sent4: The phonetists' dedication to understanding speech sounds was unwavering.
meanings.sent5: The phonetists' work on speech sounds was groundbreaking in the field of phonetics.

meanings.definition: The phonetists studied the pronunciation of different languages.
meanings.sent1: The phonetists compared the pronunciation of English and French.
meanings.sent2: The phonetists' office was filled with books on language pronunciation.
meanings.sent3: The phonetists' pronunciation of the word 'onomatopoeia' always made people smile.
meanings.sent4: The phonetists' exploration of language pronunciation was like a journey around the world.
meanings.sent5: The phonetists' expertise in language pronunciation was unmatched in the department.
